title: Hyacinth (plant)
summary: Hyacinthus is a small genus of bulbous, spring-blooming perennials.[1][2] They are fragrant flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae, subfamily Scilloideae[3]  and are commonly called hyacinths /ˈhaɪəsɪnθs/. The genus is native to the area of the eastern Mediterranean from the north of Bulgaria through to the northern part of the region of Palestine.[4]
